attributes.action: Slash the sovereign grant paid to the royal family using taxpayers money
attributes.additional_details:
Austerity and social issues — http://www.cpag.org.uk/sites/default/files/Austerity%20Generation%20FINAL.pdf

Austerity and Public services — https://www.tuc.org.uk/sites/default/files/Time%20for%20Change%20%20the%20end%20of%20austerity.pdf

One article regarding the sovereign grant and other sources of income for the royal family — https://www.express.co.uk/news/royal/1144967/royal-finances-where-how-does-royal-family-get-money
attributes.background: Austerity has led to major cuts in vital services; including the police force, NHS and other social services. All the while, in this financial year alone, for example, the total Sovereign Grant was £82.2 million — using taxpayers money. As British people, we must decide where our priorities lie.

rejection.details:
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Sovereign Grant is fixed at a percentage of the income from the Crown Estate so is already self-funded.

You can find out more here: 

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/sovereign-grant-act-2011-guidance/sovereign-grant-act-2011-guidance

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
